At Serve, we set on a mission to make last mile delivery cheap, fast and reliable. And we are looking for an exceptional individual to be in charge of the most influential aspect of this mission – Autonomy software.Autonomy is what makes Serve robots work: the more robots can do, the less we need to rely on people and cars. This is how we finally bring efficiency to last mile movement of goods.Autonomy can also make robots more safe and reliable: sensors and real-time software systems can have better reaction time, visibility and predictability than a human operator.Our existing autonomy stack is already setting a high standard in terms of safety, levels of human involvement and capabilities on the sidewalk, and we are aiming to take it to the next level with your help.Your job will be to grow a world-class team of Robotics engineers and help them execute on a single mission: enable Serve do fast, safe and reliable autonomous deliveries. You will be working cross-functionally with all the teams – Hardware, Infrastructure, Product, QA, UX, Operations, – on the long term goals and strategy of the company. You will be helping the team convert that strategy into shorter term goals, to reduce the ambiguity and to define measurable expectations. You will be then helping the team execute towards the defined goals, setting a high quality bar and holding people accountable.What You'll Be DoingLead and expand the Autonomy team through hiring and nurturing talent while shaping the team's long-term structure. Develop and drive Serve's autonomy strategy, encompassing roadmap, team expansion, and technology advancements. Foster technical alignment within the team and guide crucial technical choices. Foster cross-functional collaboration with Hardware, Product, QA, and Operations teams to accelerate collective objectives. Establish, construct, and embody the company's core values and principles. What Makes You a Strong Fit5+ years of managing, growing and leveling up teams. 3+ years of prior individual contributor experience in Robotics software development. Proven track record of shipping production grade Robotics products with high safety standards. Broad understanding of Perception, Prediction, Motion Planning, Control and Mapping, and reasonably deep understanding of at least one of those fields. Track record of owning all the lifecycles of big product or business problems, including ideation, prototyping, design, implementation, testing, deployment and maintenance. Bonus pointsStrong technical depth and breadth, being able to embed self into any technical domain where the team is struggling. Strong ML background. Experience in AV, drones or similar spaces. Obsession with high-speed feedback loops and fast iteration. More About UsServe Robotics is the team that created the Postmates delivery robot and brought it to life in LA, completing tens of thousands of deliveries in LA’s busiest neighborhoods. Now we're an independent company growing rapidly in order to connect people with what they need via robots designed to serve people.We are proud to be an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.See Serve in actionServe at TED 2020 main stageCompensation Range: $220K - $280K
